nl.fw.yapool.object

Class ObjectPool<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.fw.yapool.Pool<T>
      • nl.fw.yapool.BoundPool<T>
        • nl.fw.yapool.PrunedPool<Object>
          • nl.fw.yapool.object.ObjectPool<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IPool<Object>

    public class ObjectPool<T>
extends PrunedPool<Object>
    A pool of objects.
    Author:
    FWiers

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      T acquire()
      Acquires a resource from the pool within the maximum acquire time (default 0), unless the pool is closed (throws an IllegalStateException).
      T acquire(long acquireTimeOutMs)
      Calls PrunedPool.acquire(long, long) with PrunedPool.getMaxLeaseTimeMs().
      T acquire(long acquireTimeOutMs, long maxLeasedTimeMs)
      Calls BoundPool.acquire(long) but also validates the returned resource.
      ObjectFactory getFactory()
      The factory for creating, validating and destroying pooled resources.
      void open(int amount)
      Registers this pool with the PoolPruner so that idle objects are removed from the pool.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ObjectPool

        public ObjectPool(Class<T> objectClass)
        Sets an object factory with the given object-class set.
        PrunedPool.setMaxLeaseTimeMs(long) is set to 0 so that objects can be leased forever.
        BoundPool.setMaxSize(int) is set to 65536.

    • Method Detail

      • getFactory

        Description copied from interface: IPool
        The factory for creating, validating and destroying pooled resources.

      • open

        public void open(int amount)
        Registers this pool with the PoolPruner so that idle objects are removed from the pool.
        Overrides:
        open in class PrunedPool<Object>

      • acquire

        public T acquire()
        Description copied from interface: IPool
        Acquires a resource from the pool within the maximum acquire time (default 0), unless the pool is closed (throws an IllegalStateException).
        Specified by:
        acquire in interface IPool<Object>
        Overrides:
        acquire in class Pool<Object>
        Returns:
        A resource for usage. This resource should be IPool.release(Object)d after usage.
        Throws a RuntimeException when no resource could be created.
        Throws a NoSuchElementException when no resource is available within the maximum acquire time.

      • acquire

        public T acquire(long acquireTimeOutMs)
        Description copied from class: PrunedPool
        Calls PrunedPool.acquire(long, long) with PrunedPool.getMaxLeaseTimeMs().
        Specified by:
        acquire in interface IPool<Object>
        Overrides:
        acquire in class PrunedPool<Object>
        Parameters:
        acquireTimeOutMs - acquire time in milliseconds. Any value smaller than 1 means "do not wait at all".

      • acquire

        public T acquire(long acquireTimeOutMs,
        long maxLeasedTimeMs)
        Description copied from class: PrunedPool
        Calls BoundPool.acquire(long) but also validates the returned resource. If validation fails, the resource is evicted from the pool and BoundPool.acquire(long) is called again, if there is any acquire-time left.
        Overrides:
        acquire in class PrunedPool<Object>
        maxLeasedTimeMs - if 0, lease time never exprires.
